page.title: 08TRADE IN THE B/WALTHAM
page.content: This part of Hampshire, owned by the Bishop of Winchester,has always been farming land. When the Bishop built his palace many new people were drawn into the area. Bishops Waltham was a convenient stopping place for travellers goint to and from Portsmouth, Southampton, Winchester and London. This also drew people in the village. In 1208 some of the palace was sold and the present street plan was laid down. In 1784 there were sixty entries in the Trade Directory, by 1853 there were ninety-two and by 1875 one hundred and seventeen. It steadily continued increasing and by 1931 there were nearly two hundred and the number is still increasing. There are few necessities that are not available for purchase in the town nowadays.
